metadata.titel_preek: A City Hard to Love . . . but Loved

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: Jesus enters the hostile city of Jerusalem to perform transformative work (healing, casting out demons) despite the threat of death, demonstrating a 'tough love' that seeks the city's shalom.

tekstueel_bewijs: He stayed there, at risk, to do his ministry.
He used his short three days... to heal and cast out demons.
the things that make for shalom
the possible peace and justice of the city

zender.identificatie: God (implied as the source of the 'prophets' and 'messengers')

tekstueel_bewijs: bringing good news to the city that concerns the left-behind
I care that much about the city and want it to flourish

helper.identificatie: The Church (in the latter half of the sermon)
tekstueel_bewijs: the church is an agent for forgiveness
the church in the city is the engine

tegenstander.identificatie: Imperial Power and Social Demons (Rome, Herod, Greed, Racism)
tekstueel_bewijs: men in trench coats using their walkie-talkies
demons of sexism, racism, or exploitative economics
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is described both as a physical state apparatus (Rome) and as spiritual/structural 'demons' that cause self-destruction.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Church/Hearers must imitate Jesus' love for the city by engaging in public witness and social transformation.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church / 'We'
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon moves from what Jesus did (Primary) to what 'we might' or 'must' do (Secondary) as a direct imitation.

voorbeelden_mens_subject: We can name some of the demons.
It is our work like it was his work.

voorbeelden: we are called to see the city and weep
Our love for the city is tough love.
He wanted them to see the city as it was.
willing and able to tell the truth

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses heavily on the 'Will' (Love) of Jesus as the catalyst, then attempts to recruit the 'Will' of the congregation to follow suit.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the false peace of the crowds (~S2) to the reality of the city's violence (S2), then to Jesus' restorative work (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved through 'Tough Love'—a synthesis of lament and action.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. The sermon emphasizes the 'trench coats' and the 'execution' as real threats.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon starts with a strong theocentric focus on Jesus' actions, it concludes with a heavy shift toward human agency ('It is our work'), risking a slide into moral influence/exemplarism.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Fusion of Jesus' work and our work
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: It is our work like it was his work.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the initiator of restoration
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Where Jesus comes, the city has a chance.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Jesus is presented as the model for how the church should relate to the city.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Focus on how Jesus' victory over the 'demons' of the city is a finished work that creates a new reality the church simply inhabits, rather than 're-performing' it.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Empowerment mixed with the burden of social transformation.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: The church becomes the 'engine' of grace, potentially eclipsing the Holy Spirit.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from Jesus' passion to the church's mission is rhetorically smooth but theologically shifts the actantial subject.
spanning_punten: The shift from 'He cast them out' to 'And we might'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: casting out demons and performing cures

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon assumes the church has the 'Pouvoir' (power) because it is 'the engine'.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: High; sin is seen as systemic 'demons' like racism and greed.

eschatologie.actant_van_voltooiing: Man (as the agent of the church)

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully establishes Jesus as the Subject of the Passion narrative but prematurely transfers that Subject-role to the congregation in the application phase.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The church is described as the 'engine' of reconciliation.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Position the Holy Spirit as the Subject who continues Christ's work through the church as a Receiver/Instrument.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'The church is the engine for forgiveness,' use 'The Spirit of the crucified Christ drives the church into the city to distribute the forgiveness He won.'

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer as the one who must 'cast out demons'.
identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Hearer as the 'left-behind' who is first gathered by Jesus.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize that we are the ones Jesus wept over before we are the ones who weep with Him.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Heavy on Devoir (we are called) and Vouloir (love).
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Increase Pouvoir (the power of the Resurrection).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Explicitly mention that the power to 'veto injustice' comes from the empty tomb, not human 'tough love'.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The sermon correctly identifies the 'Opponent' as more than just bad habits.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: The 'Secondary Program' (Ethics) begins to sound like it completes the 'Primary Program' (Soteriology).
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Ensure the 'Hosanna' is a response to a finished victory, not a recruitment cry for a pending one.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A powerful, socially-engaged sermon that captures the drama of Holy Week. To move from 'Mixed' to 'Grace-oriented,' ensure that the 'engine' of the church is always fueled by the external Subjectivity of God.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would praise the 'city' imagery; semiotics reveals that the 'Subject' role shifts from God to the Church halfway through.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Luke's lament; semiotics shows how the preacher uses that lament to create a mandate (Devoir) for the modern hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas helps see that the 'demons' are actantial Opponents that require a divine Subject, highlighting the danger of the church trying to fight them as the primary Subject.

volledige_subject_lijst: Jesus (arrived, brought, waved, smiled, rides, loved, noticed, wept, used, healed)
The Church (has a ministry, is called, is the engine, might cast out)
The City (kills, stones, skews, impedes, sorts, does not welcome)
appendices.notities: The sermon uses 'Hosanna' as a bridge between the divine action and human hope.
